translated: the bodhisattvas who are wise in this way have a mind of love, affection, fondness, and cherishing for all sentient beings. But sentient beings do not have a mind that cherishes themselves to that extent.

original: bdag nyid de tsam du sdug pa'i bsam pa mi 'byung ba dang / khyim thab chung ma la de tsam du sdug pa'i bsam pa mi 'byung ba dang / pha ma bu la de tsam du sdug pa'i bsam pa mi 'byung ba dang grogs rnams la de tsam du sdug pa'i bsam pa mi 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid de tsam du sdug pa'i bsam pa mi 'byung ba dang / khyim thab chung ma la de tsam du sdug pa'i bsam pa mi 'byung ba dang / pha ma bu la de tsam du sdug pa'i bsam pa mi 'byung ba dang grogs rnams la de tsam du sdug pa'i bsam pa mi 'byung ba dang /
translated: Husbands do not have a mind that cherishes their wives to that extent. Parents do not have a mind that cherishes their children to that extent. Friends do not have a mind that cherishes their friends to that extent.

original: nye du dag kyang nye du la de tsam du sdug pa'i bsam pa mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: nye du dag kyang nye du la de tsam du sdug pa'i bsam pa mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: Relatives do not have a mind that cherishes their relatives to that extent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can dag la bar 'ga' bdag nyid la bdag nyid zhe sdang skyes nas dug za ba dang / g-yang du mchong ba la sogs pa byed cing bdag @182a * //
analyzed: sems can dag la bar 'ga' bdag nyid la bdag nyid zhe sdang skyes nas dug za ba dang / g-yang du mchong ba la sogs pa byed cing bdag @182a * //
translated: Sometimes, with regard to sentient beings, one may give rise to anger toward oneself and do things like take poison or jump off a cliff.

original: nyid kyis bdag nyid la gsod pa yod do //
analyzed: nyid kyis bdag nyid la gsod pa yod do //
translated: Sometimes, with regard to sentient beings, one generates anger toward oneself and commits suicide by taking poison, jumping off a cliff, and so on.

original: de bzhin du nye du la sogs pa dang / nye du dag la brdeg btsog pa dang / gsad pa la sogs pa'i las byed pa dang / sems mnyam pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du nye du la sogs pa dang / nye du dag la brdeg btsog pa dang / gsad pa la sogs pa'i las byed pa dang / sems mnyam pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, one is not equal in one's attitude toward sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can thams cad la sdug par byed cing dus thams cad du sdug par byed pas na sems can la sems mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can thams cad la sdug par byed cing dus thams cad du sdug par byed pas na sems can la sems mnyam pa ste /
translated: But bodhisattvas are affectionate toward all sentient beings and are affectionate at all times, so they are equal in their attitude toward sentient beings.

original: 'dis ni sems can la sems mnyam pa bstan to //ğŸ”½'dod pa la ni nye mgon med //
analyzed: 'dis ni sems can la sems mnyam pa bstan to // 'dod pa la ni nye mgon med //
translated: This shows the equality of attitude toward sentient beings.ğŸ”½There is no protector other than oneself.

original: ces bya ba la 'dod pa la ni bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i zang zing bram ze dang khyim bdag la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la 'dod pa la ni bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i zang zing bram ze dang khyim bdag la sogs pa ste /
translated: With regard to desire, there is no protector such as a Brahmin or a householder who can provide material things such as food and clothing.

original: nye mgon med pa ni mdza' ba dang bshes pa 'ba' zhig la zang zing gtong ba ma yin gyi mdza' ba dang / mi mdza' ba dang / phongs pa dang ma phongs par kun la yang 'dra bar yo byad yongs su gtong ba ni nye mgon med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye mgon med pa ni mdza' ba dang bshes pa 'ba' zhig la zang zing gtong ba ma yin gyi mdza' ba dang / mi mdza' ba dang / phongs pa dang ma phongs par kun la yang 'dra bar yo byad yongs su gtong ba ni nye mgon med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is a protector of those without protection is not one who gives material things only to friends and loved ones, but one who gives away all his possessions equally to friends, enemies, the poor, and the wealthy.

original: de lta bu ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mnyam par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mnyam par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: This is how the perfection of generosity is practiced equally.

original: tshul khrims rtag tu ma nyams shing //
analyzed: tshul khrims rtag tu ma nyams shing //
translated: Constantly observing morality,

original: zhes bya ba la tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis te /ğŸ”½rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba srung ba dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba srung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis te / rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba srung ba dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba srung ba'o //
translated: There are two kinds of morality:ğŸ”½the morality of avoiding the natural evil actions, and the morality of avoiding the evil actions that are proscribed.

analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba srung ba ni phas pham pa bzhi mi 'byung bar srung ba'o //
translated: The morality of avoiding the natural evil actions is the avoidance of the four defeats.

original: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba srung ba ni phyed yol phan chad zan mi bza'o zhes bcas pa dang / rtsa mi bcad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcas pa'i rnam pa bsrung ba ste /
analyzed: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba srung ba ni phyed yol phan chad zan mi bza'o zhes bcas pa dang / rtsa mi bcad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcas pa'i rnam pa bsrung ba ste /
translated: Guarding the precepts against offenses is guarding the precepts such as not eating after noon, not cutting grass, and so on.

original: de la ji ltar rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba mi 'byung bar srung ba bzhin du bcas pa'i kha na ma thob rdul tsam tshun chad kyang mi 'byung bar srung zhing /ğŸ”½de la bar 'ga' srung //
analyzed: de la ji ltar rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba mi 'byung bar srung ba bzhin du bcas pa'i kha na ma thob rdul tsam tshun chad kyang mi 'byung bar srung zhing / de la bar 'ga' srung //
translated: Just as one guards against the occurrence of natural offenses, one guards against the occurrence of even the slightest offense against the precepts.ğŸ”½One does not guard sometimes and not at other times.

original: bar 'ga' mi srung ba ma yin gyi dus thams cad du srung ste /
analyzed: bar 'ga' mi srung ba ma yin gyi dus thams cad du srung ste /
translated: One guards at all times.

original: de ni tshul khrims rtag tu ma nyams pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni tshul khrims rtag tu ma nyams pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That is called morality that is never impaired.

original: de lta bu'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mnyam par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mnyam par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: One should practice the perfection of morality in that way, equally.

original: thams cad du bzod pa dang zhes bya ba la yul thams cad du bzod pa dang dus thams cad du bzod pa dang sems can thams cad du bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du bzod pa dang zhes bya ba la yul thams cad du bzod pa dang dus thams cad du bzod pa dang sems can thams cad du bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Patience with regard to everything means patience with regard to all objects, patience with regard to all times, and patience with regard to all sentient beings.

original: de la shar phyogs su ni bzod par bya'i //
analyzed: de la shar phyogs su ni bzod par bya'i //
translated: There is no such thing as â€œpatience is practiced in the east,

original: nub phyogs su ni bzod par mi bya zhes bya ba med pas phyogs bcu thams cad du yang @182b bzod par byed pa ni yul thams cad du bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nub phyogs su ni bzod par mi bya zhes bya ba med pas phyogs bcu thams cad du yang @182b bzod par byed pa ni yul thams cad du bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: but not in the west.â€ So, â€œpatience with regard to all objectsâ€ means that one practices patience everywhere in the ten directions.

original: 'das pa'i dus su ni bzod par bya'i ma 'ongs pa'i dus su ni mi bzod ces bya ba med kyi dus gsum thams cad du'ang bzod par byed pa ni dus thams cad du bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus su ni bzod par bya'i ma 'ongs pa'i dus su ni mi bzod ces bya ba med kyi dus gsum thams cad du'ang bzod par byed pa ni dus thams cad du bzod pa'o //
translated: There is no such thing as â€œpatience is practiced in the past, but not in the future.â€ So, â€œpatience with regard to all timesâ€ means that one practices patience in all three times.

original: de la bshes pa dang mdza' ba rnams la ni bzod par bya'i dgra la sogs pa la bzod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la bshes pa dang mdza' ba rnams la ni bzod par bya'i dgra la sogs pa la bzod par mi bya'o //
translated: There is no such thing as â€œpatience is practiced with regard to friends and loved ones, but not with regard to enemies and so on.â€

original: dbang dang mthu che ba rnams la ni bzod par bya'i /
analyzed: dbang dang mthu che ba rnams la ni bzod par bya'i /
translated: There is no such thing as â€œpatience is practiced with regard to those who are powerful and influential,

original: dbang chung zhing nyam chung ba rnams la ni bzod par mi bya zhes bya ba med par ji ltar mdza' ba'i rnams la bzod pa bzhin du dgra la yang bzod par byed la /
analyzed: dbang chung zhing nyam chung ba rnams la ni bzod par mi bya zhes bya ba med par ji ltar mdza' ba'i rnams la bzod pa bzhin du dgra la yang bzod par byed la /
translated: but not with regard to those who are powerless and weak.â€ So, just as one is patient with friends, one is also patient with enemies.

original: 'di ltar dbang mthu che ba'i rnams la bzod par byed pa bzhin du mthu chung ngu'i rnams la yang bzod par byed pas na sems can thams cad la bzod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang mthu che ba'i rnams la bzod par byed pa bzhin du mthu chung ngu'i rnams la yang bzod par byed pas na sems can thams cad la bzod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, one should practice the perfection of patience equally toward all sentient beings, since one should practice patience toward those who have great power just as one should practice patience toward those who have little power.

original: de lta bur bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mnyam par bsgrub pa'o //ğŸ”½thams cad don la brtson chen rtsom //
analyzed: de lta bur bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mnyam par bsgrub pa'o // thams cad don la brtson chen rtsom //
translated: One should practice the perfection of effort equally toward all sentient beings, since one should practice effort for the sake of all sentient beings just as one should practice effort for one's own sake.ğŸ”½One should practice the perfection of wisdom equally toward all sentient beings, since one should practice wisdom for the sake of all sentient beings just as one should practice wisdom for one's own sake.ğŸ”½One should practice the perfection of skill in means equally toward all sentient beings, since one should practice skill in means for the sake of all sentient beings just as one should practice skill in means for one's own sake.ğŸ”½One should practice the perfection of vows equally toward all sentient beings, since one should practice vows for the sake of all sentient beings just as one should practice vows for one's own sake.

original: zhes bya ba la ji ltar bdag gi don bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa de ltar sems can thams cad kyi don bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / ji ltar dge ba gcig 'grub par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa de ltar dge ba thams cad 'grub par bya ba'i phyir yang brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i don chen thams cad la brtson chen rtsom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ji ltar bdag gi don bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa de ltar sems can thams cad kyi don bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / ji ltar dge ba gcig 'grub par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa de ltar dge ba thams cad 'grub par bya ba'i phyir yang brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i don chen thams cad la brtson chen rtsom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: One should practice the perfection of power equally toward all sentient beings, since one should practice power for the sake of all sentient beings just as one should practice power for one's own sake.ğŸ”½One should practice the perfection of direct knowledge equally toward all sentient beings, since one should practice direct knowledge for the sake of all sentient beings just as one should practice direct knowledge for one's own sake.

original: de lta bu ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mnyam par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mnyam par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Such is the practice of the perfection of effort.ğŸ”½Always virtuous meditation.

original: rtag tu dge ba'i bsam gtan dang // zhes bya ba la bsam gtan rnam pa gsum ste nyon mongs pa can dang dag par gyur pa dang zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu dge ba'i bsam gtan dang // zhes bya ba la bsam gtan rnam pa gsum ste nyon mongs pa can dang dag par gyur pa dang zag pa med pa'o //

analyzed: de la bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i ro la chags pa'i bsam gtan ni nyon mongs pa can zhes bya'o //

original: de'ang bar 'ga' bsgom /
analyzed: de'ang bar 'ga' bsgom /

analyzed: bar 'ga' mi bsgom pa ma yin gyi dus thams cad du bsgom pas rtag tu dge ba'i bsam gtan pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: de lta bu ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mnyam par bsgrub pa'o //

original: shes rab kyang ni rnam mi @183a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyang ni rnam mi @183a * //

original: rtog / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtog / zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

analyzed: de lta bu ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mnyam pa nyid du bsgrub pa'o //

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' yi //

translated: In that, the bodhisattvaâ€™s

translated: The practice of the six perfections as explained above is to be known as the bodhisattvaâ€™s equal mind in the practice of the perfections.

analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni sems can gyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa la sems mnyam pa bstan to //

analyzed: phan 'dogs pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug go zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can la phan 'dogs par byed pa bstan to //

translated: Forbearance with harm. When other sentient beings harm him physically, etc., and speak harshly, he does not retaliate physically or verbally. This is called forbearance with harm.

analyzed: chos rnams la yod par mi rigs pa ste ;
translated: reasonable to be attached to self, sentient beings, and phenomena.ğŸ”½One who

original: gnyen po'i chos de drug la gnas pa ni nag po'i chos las bzlog ste /
analyzed: gnyen po'i chos de drug la gnas pa ni nag po'i chos las bzlog ste /
translated: abides in those six antidotes is opposed to the dark qualities.

original: dkar po'i phyogs la gnas pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'bogs shing khyad par du 'gro ba'i chos yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs la gnas pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'bogs shing khyad par du 'gro ba'i chos yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: Since one abides in the bright side, one is endowed with the six perfections from the perfection of generosity to the perfection of wisdom, and one is endowed with the qualities that lead to distinction.

original: / yon tan gyi gzugs brnyan du gyur pa dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa drug ste /
analyzed: / yon tan gyi gzugs brnyan du gyur pa dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa drug ste /
translated: Six verses on the analysis of the reflected image of the virtues.

original: gcig rtsa ba drug pa'o zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug las nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i rgyur bshad de /
analyzed: gcig rtsa ba drug pa'o zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug las nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i rgyur bshad de /
translated: The cause of the degeneration of the six perfections and the cause of the increase of the six perfections have been explained.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu la gnas na ni yon tan gyi gzugs brnyan la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu la gnas na ni yon tan gyi gzugs brnyan la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who abides in the cause of the degeneration of the six perfections abides in the reflected image of the virtues.

original: de la yang dag pa'i yon tan med kyi /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i yon tan med kyi /
translated: Therein, there are no real virtues,

original: yon tan sgyu ma tsam la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan sgyu ma tsam la gnas pa'o //
translated: but one abides in mere illusory virtues.

original: gal te pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu la gnas na ni byang chub sems @195a * //
analyzed: gal te pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu la gnas na ni byang chub sems @195a * //
translated: If one abides in the cause of the perfections, one will attain the result of the perfections.ğŸ”½

original: dpa' de yang dag pa'i yon tan la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dpa' de yang dag pa'i yon tan la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: If he is established in the cause of the perfections, then that bodhisattva is said to be established in the true virtues.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis rtsom mo //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis rtsom mo //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, two verses are begun.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang po ni rtsa ba drug pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang po ni rtsa ba drug pa'o //
translated: In that regard, the first verse has six roots.

original: stobs pa dang zhes bya ba la phyi dang nang gi sbyin no zhes tshig gis stobs par byed pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: stobs pa dang zhes bya ba la phyi dang nang gi sbyin no zhes tshig gis stobs par byed pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Giving means giving externally and internally. One who merely makes a verbal promise, I will give,

original: phyi nang gi dngos po gtong ba'i sbyin pa sgrub pa med pa na sbyin pa yang dag pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: phyi nang gi dngos po gtong ba'i sbyin pa sgrub pa med pa na sbyin pa yang dag pa ma yin gyi /
translated: is not truly giving, if he does not practice giving by relinquishing external and internal things.

original: sbyin pa'i gzugs brnyan la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gzugs brnyan la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He is said to be established in the mere image of giving.

original: tshul 'chos dang zhes bya ba phas pham pa dang ltung ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa ni mi srung zhing nyes pa rgyun du 'byung la /
analyzed: tshul 'chos dang zhes bya ba phas pham pa dang ltung ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa ni mi srung zhing nyes pa rgyun du 'byung la /
translated: Hypocrisy means not guarding against the faults of the defeats, residual faults, and so forth, and constantly committing faults.

original: spyod lam tsam gyi sgo nas tshul 'chos pa la yon tan dang 'dra bar ston pa ni tshul khrims kyi gzugs brnyan la gnas pa zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½ngag 'jam pa dag ston pa dang // zhes bya ba la /ğŸ”½sems la sems can thams cad kyi zhe sdang spangs pa'i byams pa med pa la /
analyzed: spyod lam tsam gyi sgo nas tshul 'chos pa la yon tan dang 'dra bar ston pa ni tshul khrims kyi gzugs brnyan la gnas pa zhes bya ba'o // ngag 'jam pa dag ston pa dang // zhes bya ba la / sems la sems can thams cad kyi zhe sdang spangs pa'i byams pa med pa la /
translated: The hypocrite is one who, by mere outward behavior, pretends to have good qualities.

original: rtag tu sems can la gsod par bya ba'i zhe sdang dang / sems ldan zhing tshig gi sgo nas 'jam zhing snyan pa tsam smra ba ni bzod pa'i gzugs brnyan la gnas pa zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½glo bur 'jug pa de bzhin te //
analyzed: rtag tu sems can la gsod par bya ba'i zhe sdang dang / sems ldan zhing tshig gi sgo nas 'jam zhing snyan pa tsam smra ba ni bzod pa'i gzugs brnyan la gnas pa zhes bya'o // glo bur 'jug pa de bzhin te //
translated: The hypocrite in patience is one who, without the mental attitude of love which is the abandonment of hatred toward all sentient beings, always has hatred toward sentient beings, and who, while having that hatred, speaks gentle and pleasant words.

original: zhes bya ba la rgyun du dge ba la brtson 'grus byed pa ni med kyi skye bo mang po'i nang du brtson 'grus che ba dang phul 'phral la glo bur du brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni brtson 'grus kyi gzugs brnyan la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rgyun du dge ba la brtson 'grus byed pa ni med kyi skye bo mang po'i nang du brtson 'grus che ba dang phul 'phral la glo bur du brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni brtson 'grus kyi gzugs brnyan la gnas pa'o //
translated: The hypocrite in effort is one who, without continuous effort at virtue, suddenly makes great effort in the midst of many people.

original: lus dang ngag yid de bzhin ni //
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid de bzhin ni //
translated: Likewise, body, speech, and mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni lus zhi ste shing drung dang brag la sogs pa'i gnas na gnas pa dang / ngag zhi ste smra ba mang po mi smra bar byed kyang sems la rgod pa dang g-yeng ba rnam pa sna tshogs rgyun du 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lus zhi ste shing drung dang brag la sogs pa'i gnas na gnas pa dang / ngag zhi ste smra ba mang po mi smra bar byed kyang sems la rgod pa dang g-yeng ba rnam pa sna tshogs rgyun du 'byung ste /
translated: The body is tranquil, dwelling in a place such as under a tree or in a cave. Speech is tranquil, not speaking much. But the mind is agitated and distracted in various ways.

original: de ni bsam gtan gyi gzugs brnyan la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan gyi gzugs brnyan la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is called dwelling in the reflection of concentration.ğŸ”½Skill in the arts and crafts,ğŸ”½and in the three vehicles.

original: tshig snyan phun sum tshogs pa dang // zhes bya ba la theg pa gsum gyi chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la shes pa ni med kyi /
analyzed: tshig snyan phun sum tshogs pa dang // zhes bya ba la theg pa gsum gyi chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la shes pa ni med kyi /
translated: Skill in the arts and crafts means being skilled in worldly crafts and treatises, and in the treatises of the three vehicles.

original: 'jig rten gyi sgra'i gtsug lag dang rgyu'i gtsug lag shes shing smra ba'i dus na tshig 'brel ba tsam du smra bar zad kyi don gang la bya gtol med na shes rab kyi gzugs brnyan la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi sgra'i gtsug lag dang rgyu'i gtsug lag shes shing smra ba'i dus na tshig 'brel ba tsam du smra bar zad kyi don gang la bya gtol med na shes rab kyi gzugs brnyan la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: But when speaking, one speaks only about the connection of words, without knowing the meaning to which they refer. This is called dwelling in the reflection of wisdom.

original: bsgrub pa rab tu spangs pa ste //
analyzed: bsgrub pa rab tu spangs pa ste //
translated: Abandoning practice,

original: @195b yang dag ma yin par yang bshad //
analyzed: @195b yang dag ma yin par yang bshad //
translated: and also called unreal.

original: ces bya ba la stobs pa tsam la gnas nas tshigs snyan pa phun gsum tshogs pa la gnas par zad kyi sbyin pa sgrub pa nas chos kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i sgrub pa med na /
analyzed: ces bya ba la stobs pa tsam la gnas nas tshigs snyan pa phun gsum tshogs pa la gnas par zad kyi sbyin pa sgrub pa nas chos kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i sgrub pa med na /
translated: Thus, one who abides in mere generosity and mere pleasant speech is not a bodhisattva, but one who abides in the perfection of generosity and the perfection of pleasant speech.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de yang dag pa'i byang chub ni sems can gyi le lo sems dpa' ma yin par bshad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de yang dag pa'i byang chub ni sems can gyi le lo sems dpa' ma yin par bshad de /
translated: If there is no practice of generosity, etc., and no practice of realizing the general and specific characteristics of phenomena, then that one is not a bodhisattva.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan tsam la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par bshad do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan tsam la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par bshad do //
translated: One who abides in the mere reflection of the perfections is explained as not a bodhisattva.

original: bzlog pa rab tu sbyor ba ni //
analyzed: bzlog pa rab tu sbyor ba ni //
translated: The application of the opposite

original: yang dag par ni de bshad do //
analyzed: yang dag par ni de bshad do //
translated: is explained as the correct one.

original: zhes bya ba la gong du bshad pa'i stobs pa nas tshig snyan pa phun chub sems dpa' bdag nyid sum tshogs pa spyod pa las bzlog ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gong du bshad pa'i stobs pa nas tshig snyan pa phun chub sems dpa' bdag nyid sum tshogs pa spyod pa las bzlog ste /
translated: The opposite of the practice of generosity, etc., up to the practice of pleasant speech, is explained as the correct practice of generosity, etc., up to the correct practice of pleasant speech.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa nas chos kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i shes rab la spyod pa na byang chub sems dpa' de yang dag pa'i yon tan la gnas par bshad do //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa nas chos kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i shes rab la spyod pa na byang chub sems dpa' de yang dag pa'i yon tan la gnas par bshad do //
translated: When he practices generosity and so on up to the wisdom that realizes the characteristics of dharmas, the bodhisattva is said to abide in the true virtues.

original: 'dul ba rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /ğŸ”½bzod pa thob pa'i gnas /
analyzed: 'dul ba rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la / bzod pa thob pa'i gnas /
translated: A verse on the analysis of conversion.

original: sa de ltar yang dag pa'i yon tan la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des ni sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud la pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / mi mthun pa yod pa'i phyogs rnams 'dul bar byed par nus te /ğŸ”½de bas na 'dul ba rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa dpa' rnams bla na med pa'i gcig gis bstan to //
analyzed: sa de ltar yang dag pa'i yon tan la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des ni sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud la pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / mi mthun pa yod pa'i phyogs rnams 'dul bar byed par nus te / de bas na 'dul ba rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa dpa' rnams bla na med pa'i gcig gis bstan to //
translated: The bodhisattva who thus abides in the true virtues is able to convert the mental series of beings who are in the resistant states opposed to the six transcendences.

original: de'ang mdor na /
analyzed: de'ang mdor na /
translated: Therefore, one verse on the analysis of conversion, the first half of which shows the conversion of others and the second half the conversion of oneself.ğŸ”½In brief, the bodhisattva's conversion of others is to be understood as fourfold:

original: gang gis 'dul ba dang / sa gang la gnas pa na 'dul ba dang / chos gang bsgrubs pas 'dul ba dang / gang gis 'dul ba dang / gang 'dul bas 'dul ba rnam par dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: gang gis 'dul ba dang / sa gang la gnas pa na 'dul ba dang / chos gang bsgrubs pas 'dul ba dang / gang gis 'dul ba dang / gang 'dul bas 'dul ba rnam par dbye ba bstan to //
translated: The verse shows the analysis of the means of conversion, the stage on which the bodhisattva stands when he converts, the Dharma which he practices in order to convert, the one who converts, and the one who is converted.

original: blo ldan zhes bya ba las kun ni sa pa dang / byang chub tu bcu kun la bya ste /
analyzed: blo ldan zhes bya ba las kun ni sa pa dang / byang chub tu bcu kun la bya ste /
translated: The wise one is to be understood as having all the stages and all the enlightenments.

original: sa gang la gnas pa'i tshe 'dul zhe na /
analyzed: sa gang la gnas pa'i tshe 'dul zhe na /
translated: At what stage does he stand when he converts?

original: sa bcu la gnas pa'i tshe 'dul lo //
analyzed: sa bcu la gnas pa'i tshe 'dul lo //
translated: He stands on the ten stages when he converts.

original: sbyin pa la sogs nyer bsgrubs pas //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs nyer bsgrubs pas //
translated: By practicing generosity and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la chos gang bsgrubs she na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la chos gang bsgrubs she na /
translated: What Dharma does he practice?

original: sa bcu rnams su pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi chos rnams bsgrubs pas 'dul lo //
analyzed: sa bcu rnams su pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi chos rnams bsgrubs pas 'dul lo //
translated: He practices the Dharma of the six perfections on the ten stages in order to convert.ğŸ”½By means of sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams kyis zhes bya ba la su yis 'dul zhe na /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis zhes bya ba la su yis 'dul zhe na /
translated: By whom does he convert?

original: sems can rnams kyis 'dul lo //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis 'dul lo //
translated: By means of sentient beings.

original: mi mthun phyogs rnams drug ni 'dul bar byed //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs rnams drug ni 'dul bar byed //
translated: The six counteragents are the ones to be converted.

original: ces bya ba la ci zhig 'dul zhe na /
analyzed: ces bya ba la ci zhig 'dul zhe na /
translated: What is to be converted?

original: sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud la pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser snga nas 'chal ba'i shes rab @196a * //ğŸ”½kyi bar dag yod par 'dul te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud la pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser snga nas 'chal ba'i shes rab @196a * // kyi bar dag yod par 'dul te /
translated: The six perfections are the antidotes to the six nonvirtues in the mindstreams of sentient beings.ğŸ”½The bodhisattva subdues the nonvirtues of sentient beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa bsgrubs pas ni sems can gyi ser sna 'dul lo //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa bsgrubs pas ni sems can gyi ser sna 'dul lo //
translated: By practicing generosity, he subdues the stinginess of sentient beings.

original: tshul khrims bsgrubs pas ni sems can gyi ngan pa'i ngang tshul 'dul lo //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsgrubs pas ni sems can gyi ngan pa'i ngang tshul 'dul lo //
translated: By practicing morality, he subdues the immorality of sentient beings.

original: bzod pa bsgrubs pas ni khong khro ba 'dul lo /
analyzed: bzod pa bsgrubs pas ni khong khro ba 'dul lo /
translated: By practicing patience, he subdues anger.

original: brtson 'grus bsgrubs pas ni sems can gyi le lo 'dul lo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus bsgrubs pas ni sems can gyi le lo 'dul lo //
translated: By practicing effort, he subdues the laziness of sentient beings.

original: bsam gtan bsgrubs pas ni sems can gyi sems g-yeng ba 'dul lo //
analyzed: bsam gtan bsgrubs pas ni sems can gyi sems g-yeng ba 'dul lo //
translated: By practicing concentration, he subdues the distraction of sentient beings.

original: shes rab bsgrubs pas ni sems can gyi 'chal ba'i shes rab 'dul lo //
analyzed: shes rab bsgrubs pas ni sems can gyi 'chal ba'i shes rab 'dul lo //
translated: By practicing wisdom, he subdues the immorality of sentient beings.

original: lung bstan pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la de ltar byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyang yang dag pa'i yon tan la gnas shing sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud la pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod
analyzed: lung bstan pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la de ltar byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyang yang dag pa'i yon tan la gnas shing sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud la pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, himself abiding in the true virtues, and engaged in the discipline of the six perfections in the mental series of beings, who have the resistances to those perfections,

original: pa 'dul ba la zhugs pa de bdag nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lung bsgom pa 'thob par 'gyur zhing mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i gnas /
analyzed: pa 'dul ba la zhugs pa de bdag nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lung bsgom pa 'thob par 'gyur zhing mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i gnas /
translated: obtains the prediction of his own unsurpassed enlightenment and the acceptance of the non origination of things.

original: sa brgyad pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: He also enters the eighth stage.

original: de bas na lung du bstan pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na lung du bstan pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bstan to //
translated: Thus, the three verses on the analysis of prediction are completed.

original: blo ldan lung bstan rnam gnyis te //
analyzed: blo ldan lung bstan rnam gnyis te //
translated: The wise are predicted in two ways,

original: gang zag dus kyi bye brag gis //
analyzed: gang zag dus kyi bye brag gis //
translated: by the distinction of person and time.

original: zhes bya ba la blo dang ldan pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la blo dang ldan pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The wise bodhisattvas are predicted to unsurpassed enlightenment in two ways.

original: gang zag gi bye brag gis lung bstan pa dang / dus kyi bye brag gis lung bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag gi bye brag gis lung bstan pa dang / dus kyi bye brag gis lung bstan pa'o //
translated: The prediction is made by the particular person and the prediction is made by the particular time.

original: de la gang zag gi bye brag gis bstan pa la rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la gang zag gi bye brag gis bstan pa la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The prediction by the particular person is of four kinds:

original: rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag lung bstan pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i gang zag lung bstan pa dang / mngon du gyur pa'i gang zag lung bstan pa dang / mngon du gyur pa ma yin pa'i gang zag lung bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag lung bstan pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i gang zag lung bstan pa dang / mngon du gyur pa'i gang zag lung bstan pa dang / mngon du gyur pa ma yin pa'i gang zag lung bstan pa'o //
translated: the prediction of the person who is in the lineage, the prediction of the person who has generated the thought of enlightenment, the prediction of the person who is manifest, and the prediction of the person who is not manifest.

original: de la rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag lung bstan pa ni sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rigs dang sa bon yod pas byang chub tu sems bskyed kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mtshan ma snang na gang zag de
analyzed: de la rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag lung bstan pa ni sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rigs dang sa bon yod pas byang chub tu sems bskyed kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mtshan ma snang na gang zag de
translated: The prediction of the person who is in the lineage is when the person has the lineage and seed of the six perfections from generosity to wisdom, and even though he has generated the thought of enlightenment, if the signs of the six perfections appear, that person

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes lung ston gyi theg pa chen po'i rigs yod kyang rig pa'i mtshan ma med pa rnams ni 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur @196b bar lung mi ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes lung ston gyi theg pa chen po'i rigs yod kyang rig pa'i mtshan ma med pa rnams ni 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur @196b bar lung mi ston te /
translated: But they do not prophesy the enlightenment of those who have the Mahayana potential but do not have the signs of the knowable,

original: sems bskyed pa'i lung bstan pa rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag las bdag dang sems can phan par 'dod pa'i phyir dad pa dang / mos pa chen po'i shugs kyis dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i lung bstan pa rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag las bdag dang sems can phan par 'dod pa'i phyir dad pa dang / mos pa chen po'i shugs kyis dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na /
translated: The prophecy of the generation of the Thought is for the person who is in the lineage and who, with the force of great faith and interest, has made vast offerings to the Three Jewels, wishing to benefit himself and others, and has generated the Thought of unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gang zag 'di ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'tshang bar 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gang zag 'di ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'tshang bar 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to //
translated: The Tathagatas prophesy that this person will attain enlightenment in the future.

original: mngon sum du 'gyur bar lung bstan pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa chos 'chad pa'i 'og tu gang zag de 'dus na /
analyzed: mngon sum du 'gyur bar lung bstan pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa chos 'chad pa'i 'og tu gang zag de 'dus na /

analyzed: de bzhin sdug bsngal bzod pa dang // zhes bya ba la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni bdag dang sems can gyi don du phyi dang nang gi sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs myong ba nyams su blang zhing bzod par bya ba rgyun du bya ste /
translated: One should always examine the errors of body

original: de ltar byas na zhe sdang spangs shing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na zhe sdang spangs shing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, one abandons anger and perfects the perfection of patience.

original: dge ba dag kyang goms par byed //
analyzed: dge ba dag kyang goms par byed //
translated: And one cultivates virtue.

original: ces bya ba la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba rgyun du bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba rgyun du bsgom par bya ste /
translated: By means of the perfection of effort, one should cultivate virtue both mundane and supramundane continuously.

original: de ltar na le lo spangs shing brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na le lo spangs shing brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, one abandons laziness and perfects the perfection of effort.

original: de ltar bde ba'i ro mi byang ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar bde ba'i ro mi byang ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: One does not relish the taste of happiness.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i ro la ma chags shing bsam gtan gyi ro mo myang @200b bar rgyun du bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i ro la ma chags shing bsam gtan gyi ro mo myang @200b bar rgyun du bya ste /
translated: By means of the perfection of meditation, one should not be attached to the taste of the happiness of meditation, and one should not relish the taste of meditation continuously.

original: de ltar byas na bstan gtan las mi nyams par 'gyur zhing bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa myur du rdzogs par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½mtshan ma dag la mi rtog cing //
analyzed: de ltar byas na bstan gtan las mi nyams par 'gyur zhing bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa myur du rdzogs par 'gyur ro // mtshan ma dag la mi rtog cing //
translated: In this way, one does not fall from meditation and one quickly perfects the perfection of meditation.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: One does not conceptualize signs.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bdag dang chos dang sems can rnams la sogs pa dag la yod pa dang / med par rtog pa'i mtshan ma la mi rtog pa rgyun du bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bdag dang chos dang sems can rnams la sogs pa dag la yod pa dang / med par rtog pa'i mtshan ma la mi rtog pa rgyun du bya ste /
translated: One should always practice non-conceptuality with respect to the signs of existence and non-existence of self, of things, of sentient beings, etc., by means of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar byas na log pa'i shes rab spangs shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa myur du rdzogs par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½sa rnams kun la bstan pa yi //
analyzed: de ltar byas na log pa'i shes rab spangs shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa myur du rdzogs par 'gyur ro // sa rnams kun la bstan pa yi //
translated: If one acts thus, one abandons perverse wisdom and quickly perfects the perfection of wisdom.ğŸ”½The things to be done

original: rtag tu bya ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu bya ba rnams yin no //
translated: are taught on all the stages.

original: zhes bya ba la gong du bshad pa'i chos drug po dag ni sa bcu thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par yid la bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gong du bshad pa'i chos drug po dag ni sa bcu thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par yid la bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The six dharmas explained above are always to be kept in mind by the bodhisattvas on all the ten stages.

original: dam pa'i dngos po rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba drug pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dam pa'i dngos po rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba drug pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One verse with six root verses on the analysis of the highest object.

original: de ltar mi byar mi rung ba'i chos dang / rgyun du bya ba'i chos la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de yon tan dam pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar mi byar mi rung ba'i chos dang / rgyun du bya ba'i chos la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de yon tan dam pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva who abides in the Dharma that should not be practiced and in the Dharma that should be practiced constantly becomes endowed with the highest virtues.

original: yon tan dam pa dang ldan bas na byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang sems can thams cad kyi mchog dang dam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yon tan dam pa dang ldan bas na byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang sems can thams cad kyi mchog dang dam par 'gyur te /
translated: Because he is endowed with the highest virtues, the bodhisattva becomes the highest and best of all beings.

original: de bas na dam pa'i dngos po gang yin pa tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba drug pa gcig gis bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na dam pa'i dngos po gang yin pa tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba drug pa gcig gis bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the verse with six lines shows what the highest thing is.

original: chos sbyin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos sbyin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Giving the Dharma.

original: sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of giving:

original: zang zing sbyin pa dang mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / chos sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing sbyin pa dang mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / chos sbyin pa'o //
translated: giving material things, giving freedom from fear, and giving the Dharma.

original: de la sbyin pa rnam pa gsum las chos kyi sbyin pa ni sbyin pa'i dam pa yin te /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa rnam pa gsum las chos kyi sbyin pa ni sbyin pa'i dam pa yin te /
translated: Of these three kinds of giving, giving the Dharma is the highest giving.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshes sbyin pas ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa 'grub la mi 'jigs pa dang / zang zing sbyin pas ni 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir chos sbyin pa dam pa ste /
analyzed: tshes sbyin pas ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa 'grub la mi 'jigs pa dang / zang zing sbyin pas ni 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir chos sbyin pa dam pa ste /
translated: By giving the Dharma, one accomplishes the supramundane perfections, and by giving material things and fearlessness, one accomplishes the mundane perfections.

original: de bas na rdo rje gcod pa la sogs pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na rdo rje gcod pa la sogs pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Diamond Cutter Sutra and so forth say:

original: gang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis bkang ste byin pa bas /
analyzed: gang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis bkang ste byin pa bas /
translated: Compared to someone who fills the trichiliocosm with the seven precious substances and gives it away,

original: gang gis mdo 'di las tshig bzhi ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam @201a * //
analyzed: gang gis mdo 'di las tshig bzhi ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam @201a * //
translated: if someone teaches and explains just one four-line verse from this sutra,

original: bstan cing bshad na bsod nams dpag tu med pa 'phel bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bstan cing bshad na bsod nams dpag tu med pa 'phel bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the merit increases immeasurably.

original: tshul khrims dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul khrims dag ces bya ba la /
translated: As for pure discipline,

original: tshul khrims la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: discipline is of three types:

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa las gang 'phags pa rnams dgyes pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin zag pa med pa'i sdom pa ni sdom pa rnam pa gsum gyi nang na dam pa yin no //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa las gang 'phags pa rnams dgyes pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin zag pa med pa'i sdom pa ni sdom pa rnam pa gsum gyi nang na dam pa yin no //
translated: The pure nature of the morality which is pleasing to the noble ones is the undefiling vow, from among the three kinds of vows: the vow of individual liberation, the vow of concentration, and the undefiling vow.

original: yang na tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Or else, there are three kinds of morality:

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang gsum las /ğŸ”½tshul khrims rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang gsum las / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the morality of vow, the morality of gathering virtue, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.ğŸ”½The so-called pure morality

original: dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims la bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims la bya ste /
translated: is to be understood as the morality of gathering virtue.

original: dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims gsum gyi nang na dam pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims gsum gyi nang na dam pa yin no //
translated: From among the three kinds of morality of gathering virtue, it is the highest.

original: de bzhin ma skyes bzod pa dang // zhes bya ba la bzod pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de bzhin ma skyes bzod pa dang // zhes bya ba la bzod pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Likewise, the highest patience is the patience of not retaliating.

original: sdug bsngal ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / gnod pa nyams su len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa dang gsum las chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa ni bzod pa'i dam pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / gnod pa nyams su len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa dang gsum las chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa ni bzod pa'i dam pa yin no //
translated: Of these, the patience of certain knowledge of the Dharma is the best.

original: de la mos pas spyod pa'i sa bzhi las bzod pa'i dus de kho na phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rtogs pa la /
analyzed: de la mos pas spyod pa'i sa bzhi las bzod pa'i dus de kho na phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rtogs pa la /
translated: In this regard, on the four levels of earnest aspiration, the patience of certain knowledge of the Dharma is the realization of thatness through the wisdom that is accompanied by the concentration that has penetrated thatness in part.

original: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½theg chen brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang // zhes bya ba la 'jig rten pa dag lha dang mi la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o // theg chen brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang // zhes bya ba la 'jig rten pa dag lha dang mi la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: It is called the patience of certain knowledge of the Dharma.ğŸ”½The great vehicle, the practice of diligence,

original: dge ba la brtson 'grus rtsom pa yang yod /
analyzed: dge ba la brtson 'grus rtsom pa yang yod /
translated: In the world, there are those who practice diligence in virtue in order to attain the results of gods, humans, and so forth.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag rang gi theg pa la nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa'i sgo nas brtson 'grus rtsom pa yang yod mod kyi /ğŸ”½theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag rang gi theg pa la nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa'i sgo nas brtson 'grus rtsom pa yang yod mod kyi / theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Noble disciples and pratyekabuddhas do indeed practice effort by listening to, reflecting on, and cultivating their own vehicles.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni brtson 'grus thams cad kyi dam pa yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni brtson 'grus thams cad kyi dam pa yin no //
translated: But practicing effort by listening to, reflecting on, and cultivating the profound and extensive teachings of the Great Vehicle is the best of all efforts.

original: mthar ni snying rje ldan par @201b gnas //
analyzed: mthar ni snying rje ldan par @201b gnas //
translated: The best of all efforts is the fourth meditation endowed with compassion.

original: zhes bya ba la gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa las mtha'i sgras ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa las mtha'i sgras ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la bya ste /
translated: The fourth meditation is called the end, because it is the end of the meditations of the form realm, which are the first, second, third, and fourth meditations.

original: tshad med pa bzhi las snying rje tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa ni bsam gtan gyi nang na dam pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi las snying rje tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa ni bsam gtan gyi nang na dam pa yin no //
translated: The fourth meditation endowed with immeasurable compassion is the best of all meditations, because it is endowed with the immeasurable of compassion among the four immeasurables.

original: yang tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa ni bsam gtan gyi nang na dam pa yin no //
analyzed: yang tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa ni bsam gtan gyi nang na dam pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the fourth undefiled concentration endowed with the four immeasurables is the best among the concentrations.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa la //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa la //
translated: In the perfection of wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug las /
translated: Among the six perfections,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga las /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga las /
translated: from the perfection of generosity up to the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dam pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dam pa yin te /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is the best.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum la sogs pa'i nang nas kyang /
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum la sogs pa'i nang nas kyang /
translated: Therefore, even among the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines and so forth,

original: gal te sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'dod na /
translated: if one wishes to fully complete the perfection of generosity,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: one should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bshad pa rnam par gzhag pa dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la de ltar yon tan mchog dang ldan pa byang chub sems dpa' de /
analyzed: bshad pa rnam par gzhag pa dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la de ltar yon tan mchog dang ldan pa byang chub sems dpa' de /
translated: The bodhisattva, who thus possesses the highest virtues,

original: sems can 'dul bar bya ba'i thabs kyang shes shing /
analyzed: sems can 'dul bar bya ba'i thabs kyang shes shing /
translated: knows the means of disciplining sentient beings.

original: thabs de shes pas sems can rnams kyi ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs de shes pas sems can rnams kyi ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: And by knowing those means, he becomes a teacher of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi ston par 'gyur na /
analyzed: sems can gyi ston par 'gyur na /
translated: When he becomes a teacher of sentient beings,

original: sems can rnams la chos 'chad pa la yang mkhas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos 'chad pa la yang mkhas par 'gyur te /
translated: he also becomes skilled in teaching the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: chos bshad pa yang rnam pa bzhi 'chad do //
analyzed: chos bshad pa yang rnam pa bzhi 'chad do //
translated: And he teaches the Dharma in four ways.

original: gang zhe na chos rnam par gzhag pa 'chad pa dang / bden pa rnam par gzhag pa 'chad pa dang / rigs rnam par gzhag pa 'chad pa dang / theg pa rnam par gzhag pa 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhe na chos rnam par gzhag pa 'chad pa dang / bden pa rnam par gzhag pa 'chad pa dang / rigs rnam par gzhag pa 'chad pa dang / theg pa rnam par gzhag pa 'chad pa ste /
translated: What are the four? He teaches the establishment of the Dharma, he teaches the establishment of the truths, he teaches the establishment of spiritual lineages, and he teaches the establishment of the vehicles.

original: rnam par gzhag pa bzhi 'chad pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhis bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa bzhi 'chad pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhis bstan to //
translated: The teaching of the four kinds of establishment is shown by four verses.

original: mdo sogs rnam pa'i bye brag gis //
analyzed: mdo sogs rnam pa'i bye brag gis //
translated: By means of the distinctions of the sutras and so on,

original: rig pa'i gnas ni rnam par gzhag / sa rnams bdun la blo ldan pa'i //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas ni rnam par gzhag / sa rnams bdun la blo ldan pa'i //
translated: The treatises are established in seven stages by the wise.

original: chos rnams rnam par gzhag rig bya //
analyzed: chos rnams rnam par gzhag rig bya //
translated: One should know the establishment of the teachings.

original: zhes bya ba la mdo la sogs pa ni /ğŸ”½mdo'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag @202a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mdo la sogs pa ni / mdo'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag @202a * //
translated: The sutras, etc.ğŸ”½are the twelve branches of scripture, such as the discourses, aphorisms, predictions, etc.

original: bcu gnyis la bya'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis la bya'o //
translated: The treatises are established in seven stages.

original: rnam pa'i bya brag gis zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi tshul du'am /
analyzed: rnam pa'i bya brag gis zhes bya ba ni / gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi tshul du'am /
translated: By the wise means by the bodhisattvas.

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis dang mi 'gal bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis dang mi 'gal bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By the various methods means by the methods of the twelve branches of scripture, or by the methods not contradictory to the twelve branches of scripture.

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis dang mi 'gal bar nad rig pa dang / rgyu rig pa dang / sgra rig pa dang / gso ba rig pa dang / bzo'i las kyi gnas rig pa rnam par gzhag cing sems can gzhan la 'chad na /
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis dang mi 'gal bar nad rig pa dang / rgyu rig pa dang / sgra rig pa dang / gso ba rig pa dang / bzo'i las kyi gnas rig pa rnam par gzhag cing sems can gzhan la 'chad na /
translated: If the bodhisattvas, not contradicting the twelve branches of scripture, establish the treatises on grammar, logic, metrics, drama, lexicography, prosody, astrology, and the science of polity, and teach them to others,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcu kun du chos rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcu kun du chos rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: then the bodhisattvas are said to be engaged in the ten aspects of the establishment of the teachings.

original: de nyid rnam bdun brten pa las //
analyzed: de nyid rnam bdun brten pa las //
translated: The sevenfold reasoning is as follows.ğŸ”½

original: bden pa dag kyang rnam gzhag yin //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bden pa dag kyang rnam gzhag yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The four noble truths are posited

original: de kho na nyid rnam pa bdun la brten nas /
analyzed: de kho na nyid rnam pa bdun la brten nas /
translated: in dependence on the seven kinds of reality.

original: de kho na nyid rnam pa bdun 'chad cing ston pa ni bden pa bzhi rnam par gzhag pa 'chad pa yin par rig par bya'o //ğŸ”½rigs dang theg pa rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de kho na nyid rnam pa bdun 'chad cing ston pa ni bden pa bzhi rnam par gzhag pa 'chad pa yin par rig par bya'o // rigs dang theg pa rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The four noble truths are explained and taught in dependence on the seven kinds of reality.ğŸ”½The four kinds of reasoning and the three vehicles

original: rnam pa bzhi dang rnam pa gsum yin no zhes bya ba la rigs pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi dang rnam pa gsum yin no zhes bya ba la rigs pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four kinds of reasoning are

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa bsgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa ste /
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa bsgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa ste /
translated: the reasoning of dependence, the reasoning of function, the reasoning of proof, and the reasoning of nature.
